intro: Trollius sphaericus, commonly known as the globe buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive, rounded, yellow-orange flowers that resemble small globes, typically blooming in late summer. The plant has palmately divided leaves and grows in moist, rocky habitats. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, known for its showy flowers and often toxic sap. Trollius sphaericus is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens with well-drained soil.
